Question: Plays thought to be only partly written by this person are marked with a dagger (†) below.
Hints: The Halls had one child, Elizabeth, who married twice but died without children in 1670, ending this person’s direct line.
Many critics believe that this person's greatest tragedies represent the peak of his art.
Some scholars claim that members of this person's family were Catholics, at a time when Catholic practice was against the law.
